title: Managing Research Projects: Supporting Researchers in Collaborative Project Management
abstractText:
This initiative focuses on the development of project management skills including those necessary to collaborate on research projects in the social sciences at institutional, national and international level. We seek to identify the skills needed by researchers as they start, progress and finish projects; and different skills needed by early career, mid-career and established researchers.

The project draws upon existing expertise across social science disciplines. Groups of researchers at different career stages will work with us over the project to identify needs and advise on the development of guidance material. A conference led by senior researchers will provide an opportunity for sharing and disseminating ideas; regional workshops will be held; materials and approaches will be developed and trialled across a range of M1/M69 institutions; and a website will be developed. A community of practice will be developed which will be supportive of those participating and influence the guidance.

The project will:

  • Develop guidance in project management and collaboration for early, mid- and established career researchers which is firmly based in good practice across the social sciences
  • Evaluate mechanisms for delivering guidance on project management (good practice guides, blogging etc)

Further dissemination events will be held later mainly with M1/M69 institutions to aid the embedding of good practice at institutional level and so address sustainability. Guidance materials and project outcomes will be disseminated via the project website.
